name: Katathani Phuket Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: First impressions of Katathani were overwhelmed by its size: it is the size of a large village – just emphasised by the fact that we were taken to our room in a golf buggy. We had a junior suite which was spacious and comfortable with a separate sitting area down a step containing a day bed, chairs and a dining table leading to a balcony looking directly over Kata Noi Beach. We were particularly amused by the “mattress menu” which allowed you to change mattresses and pillows if you were not comfortable with the ones provided. The air-conditioning was very over-enthusiastic: no matter how much we altered the settings, the room was always just this side of refrigerated: great when you have just come in from the beach, but rather chilly in the morning. There was always a rush to get onto the balcony to warm up a bit!
reviews.title: Enormous - too enormous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: Breakfast was a help yourself affair in the hotel’s main dining room: we tended to arrive for breakfast at about 9.15 and almost always had to wait for a table: the room was simply not big enough to cope with a mass influx of guests all at once. That said, the food on offer was very good indeed. Of the hotel’s several other restaurants we ate in only two: good fresh fish in one and Thai curries in the other – nothing exceptional but greatly over-priced. In fact we found much in the hotel to be overpriced – perhaps because of its relative isolation, they felt that they could jack the prices up. A beer from the beach bar is charged at 125baht (we never paid more than 70 baht in any other hotel) which is way over the top, when you can walk down onto the public beach and buy the same thing for 60 baht or cross the road to the local mini market and get one for 30 baht. Snack lunches were similarly over-priced, so we soon took to having a larger breakfast that we would usually have done and missing lunch. The hotel laundry prices were a rip-off: the afore-mentioned minimarket did an entire week’s worth of washing and ironing in 24 hours for the same price that the hotel would have charged for two polo shirts. Staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful – although in such an enormous place it was unusual to see the same person doing the same job twice: so one never really get to know any staff member in particular.
reviews.title: What a fantastic Place...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: After the first couple of nights, we took to venturing out for dinner which not only saved our wallets considerable damage, but also got us some good “real” Thai food, rather than the sanitised western version so often served up by hotels. This involved a pretty strenuous walk over the hill separating Kata Noi and Kata Beach – although there are usually taxis and tuk-tuks outside the hotel which would take you there. There are a couple of decent local restaurants in Kata Beach (if you can avoid the insistent and annoying Indian tailors – why do they assume that every tourist is only there to buy a cheap, badly made suit?). One night we ventured further out to beyond the enormous Club Med and had a good meal at the Kata Garden. Walking back we caught the weekly performance of “Thai Elvis” – a portly bar-owner who gave it his all, much to the delight of a hugely appreciative audience. We all left with huge smiles on our faces!
reviews.title: Pure paradise!!! You have to go!
Wonderful!
reviews.text: We spent one evening in Patong: if only to say that we had been there. We found a good Thai restaurant on the sea front, which did not appear to be too over-priced. After dark, the place is obviously aiming to cater for the sex-tourist: girls, boys, ladyboys etc. accost you on every corner trying to get you into their bars. Couples of all varieties are entwined on the beach. Neon lights flash. If that’s what you are looking for – fine; if not – avoid the place after dark! Interestingly enough, Katathani hotel was one of the few places that we have stayed at in Thailand that specifically bans the “entertainment of guests” in rooms. It’s quite refreshing not to find oneself sitting next to a western man and a “professional” Thai lady at breakfast!

reviews.title: Can I set the record straight?
reviews.text: Final point about the hotel: there are sunloungers spread throughout the well kept grounds and around the pools. But there are an awful lot of German guests: so if you don’t get up early you will not get the position you want! The sunloungers and umbrellas on the beach are privately owned and you must therefore pay a beach boy for their use

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel
reviews.text: We've just returned from two weeks at the Katathani and fully recommend this hotel. We were in a junior suite in the Thani wing, overlooking the pools and beach. The food is excellent, staff very helpful and friendly, and the situation of the hotel is perfect - quiet but within a 15 minute walk from Kata village and a 20 minute tuctuc ride away from Patong. The hotel masseuses who also offer manicures, pedicures and hair braiding are excellent - an one hour Thai massage will only cost 6 euros. Only negative point is the price of drinks at the hotel - for example, a Thai beer costs 125 bahts, whereas its only 30 in the shops.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Can recommend the excursions to Phi Phi island and the sea canoes. We booked through Hotelplan with Phuket Adventures which are excellent, well organized, friendly and a good time was had by all.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you want a relaxing holiday

likes.liked: — the hotel was beatiful, and the its close location to the beach
likes.disliked: — distance from everything (the hotel is at the very tip of the island)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our second time in Thailand, and we fell in love with the country and the people all over again.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

likes.disliked: — Not enough lifts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friend and I stayed at the Kata Thani From 18 Aug - 28th. We loved the hotel and its amenities, but if you came to party, stay closer to Patong.
reviews.title: ok with Kata Thani

likes.disliked: — noisy, and the resort is getting old

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the good stuff. We stayed at the Bhuri wing, which is the smaller part of the hotel across the street from the beach. The main Thani wing is right by the beach and is much bigger and has most of the restaurants, the spa, and 4 of 5 pools on its grounds. We asked to be on the top floor and if we could have a sea-view room when we first checked in. We got to be on the top floor, but were told that the sea-view rooms in the Thani wing are for smokers. We were a little disappointed, but we discovered that our wing was much better anyway because of the VERY noisy birds that were in the trees on the other side of the Thani wing! Our room was ALWAYS clean and smelled pretty good (no dampness to report). It was a good sized room for two people, it wasn't huge but it wasn't claustrophobic either. The bathroom was a little tricky to negotiate for two people who were just friends =) But after a few days we got used to it and didn't mind (one could always go out to the balcony and enjoy the scenery while the other was in the bathroom). By the way, the minibar's prices are pretty reasonable (one bottled water was 40 baht), and you get two bottles of waters free everyday. However, these are in glass bottles and not convenient if you want to take them with you when you go out. Go to Central Mall in Phuket town (or any grocery store that you can find) and stock up on water,(6.50 baht was the cheapest) drinks or snacks.
reviews.title: A wonderful holiday

likes.disliked: — The bottle opener is on the bathroom wall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the last hotel we stayed in on our Honeymoon - the drink on arrival was an apple juice, we were led to the room and it's clear to say they are tired a little smelly and honestly have seen similar in lower grade 4 star properties. The staff were ok, however those service at breakfast were dissapointingly slow, a few could be termed as sullen and it could take 20 minutes to attract the attention of a passing coffee waiter!
reviews.title: Disappointing for a 5 star resort

likes.disliked: — The rooms need a bit of an update and service could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried 2 restaurants, the Italian and Fishermans Wharf, the Italian was disappointing (an irish coffee was an art form, however after the 2 minute flaming there was no alcohol left) but the Fisherman's was good and we ate here a couple of times.
reviews.title: Lovely Katathani

likes.disliked: — The Grand Suite was in need of refurbishment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the best bit - the beach was fantastic and it's 5* due to it;s location. Also the rates do not reflect a 5* hotel and this cost a fraction of what we paid in other resorts. Those serving on the beach were lovely and we chose to give our money to them as they were hospitable and friendly rather than the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful end to our honeymoon

likes.liked: — Its set ou t was fab and the amount of pools.
likes.disliked: — The torrential rain caused a flood - did not affect accommodation however - interesting to see though!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would certainly go back for the beach, but probably to Mom Tri's which shares this beach rather than go here again.
reviews.title: When can I go back????

likes.disliked: — The beach is quite dangerous at times, but the pools make up for the lack of accessibilty to the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bar opposite was also a lovely place to have a couple of drinks and games of Connect 4!
reviews.title: Excellent family resort
Suites are wonderful, other rooms are not. Overbooking problem: beware!
reviews.text: The suites are lovely, and are facing the beach and look directly at the lawns, gardens, and pools. The "Junior Suites" are just fine and lovely, except the bathtub is smallish.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We had booked the main suites (top of the line) but they were overbooked. We learned from talking to other guests that overbooking of the suites is a chronic situation and that downgrading guests because of overbooking isn't uncommon. The hotel downgraded us for three of our six nights to Junior Suites so we stayed in both the Junior and full suites. (They comped us spa treatments and two dinners plus refunded the rate difference.)
reviews.title: Perfect
The facts about Kata Thani Resort
reviews.text: The full grand suites are larger and have a wonderful bathtub and shower, plus a better view. Are the worth the extra cost? That is a personal decision. Both are good.

reviews.title: What a dreadful hotel
reviews.text: The non-suites ARE across the road and looked to be quite ordinary, or even rather pedestrian. I would have been furious had we been downgraded to a regular room with no beach view and a 5-10 minute walk to the pools which are in front of the Junior Suites.

reviews.title: Kata Thani - wonderful place to stay
reviews.text: So, the upgrade to the Junior Suites is definitely advised, although there seems to be no assurance that you will be able to get one when you do arrive, so there is some chance of having a vacation disaster upon arrival.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed at the Katathani with my husband and 5 y.o. son in a Grand Suite in OCT 06. The room was of a very good standard; and reasonably large, with sea views. This resort is essentially two separate resorts within one. The Thani section is comprised of the Grand and Junior Suites. It has a fantastic location with lawns sweeping down to the ocean. This is by far the more upscale section of the resort. The Bhuri section is separated from the ocean by a road. Each of the resorts has its own swimming pool/s - the swimming pool closest to the Grand Suites is the nicest of all, but open to all hotel guests regardless of their room choice. The outstanding feature of the hotel is the beachfront location - a far more relaxing alternative to busy Patong. Although it was low season, the pools were seemingly quite busy, with some heated moments over the reserving of pool chairs. There are several restaurants in the hotel but they are all very expensive by Phuket standards. However there are many cheaper local alternatives in Kata, that serve delicious food at very reasonable prices. Kata also has a reasonable range of tailors and market shopping including sarongs, pirated DVDs, copy bags etc etc. Although the trip to Kata is only 2 mins away by taxi or tuk-tuk, the hotel as well as the local taxi company runs a local rort on tourists with set prices to all destinations around Phuket that far exceed the usual prices you would pay on other parts of the island. The moment you step out the front door of the hotel, the race is on to secure you transport. Overall the service met our expectations. Staff were always pleasant and obliging. They did however become more animated when trying to sell you transport, a tour through a friend or a massage....all part of the fun. In summary if you are seeking a relaxing location with a wide range of facilities, and good standard of accommodation I would well recommend the Katathani Beach Resort.
reviews.title: Katathani, great for families

likes.disliked: — Staff of service desk not overly helpful and expensive transport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: A wonderfull stay at the Kata Thani. We stayed in a junior suite, of good size and ocean view. All the junior and grand suites have ocean view. If you have the economy for it book a grand suite, as it has a great bathroom. There are 2 saltwater pools at the hotel main area, there are also one pool at the Burhi wing on the other side of the road (this is a bit more family friendly), and one pool at the beach club. There is a free shuttle to Phuket town once a day in each direction, and one shuttle to Patong each night for 100 bath. This hotel is in Kata Noi (little Kata) and it is a quiet place. You can get every thing you need in Kata, its just a nice walk away at day time, and a short tuc-tuc ride at night.
reviews.title: great

likes.disliked: — all was good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, Very beautiful the only downside is that after 10 pm there is no night life so you have to go to Patong which it 20 mins away in tuk tuk.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel
Loved It!!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Katathani in March of this year. Sorry for the late review but I have read some really bad reviews on this hotel and we found it to be completely different. We stayed at the KathaBuri I think it was called (not the main building) - and we are so glad that we did. The Katathani is massive and granted it is beachfront but the Kata Buri was alot quieter. It was at the end of the street so no traffic could go past.

reviews.title: Would definitely go back again....Highly Recommended
reviews.text: The rooms were beautiful - great bathrooms, the shower was all glass so you could see into your room through the shower. There was also the most amazing waterfall in the bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Katathani for a week after 3 days in Bangkok. It was awesome! They knew we were there for our honeymoon and had placed rose petals on the bed and a small piece of cake and a welcome fruit basket in the room.
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon!

likes.liked: — It was quiet but close enough to travel into the
likes.disliked: — lack of net access in our rooms and the cost associated with it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had ocean views, and our room was nice. I would not consider it a 5 star room, but it was clean and comfortable. The beds are HARD, but they obviously realize that Westerners prefer softer beds because there was a comment card on the bed when we checked in that specifically asked about the softness and our comfort level. After our first night, I filled in the card and requested a softer bed and they placed a topper on the mattress. It was still quite firm, but it was not so bad that it disrupted our sleep.
reviews.title: An Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts every morning are great! The fresh fruit is wonderful and they are very eager to make anything for you at the waffle and omelet stands.
reviews.title: Fantastic Katathani

likes.liked: — The stunning view from our room
likes.disliked: — nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I loved staying in a quieter area (instead of Patong). We rented a scooter for about $4 US a day and we traveled all over the island. The scooter is a little difficult if you aren't a normal motorcycle rider, but we were careful and did not drive around during peak traffic hours. It was a great way to get around.
reviews.title: Exceed expectation and much more!

likes.liked: — Pools, beach, Staff services, Airport transfer, Food, Tour desk
likes.disliked: — Massage ladies who are not well verse in traditional thai massage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at check in/out was great. The service at breakfast every morning was wonderful. We did not eat at any of the restautrants for any other meal, preferring instead to travel around the island and explore.
reviews.title: Special place to stay amazing !!!!

likes.disliked: — Leaving

reviews.title: Loved the serenity!
reviews.text: What can I say, the Katathani Resort was excellent. I have travelled all over the world and stayed in many places. I have had some really bad experiences in Thailand so Katathani will not dissappoint. The breakfast buffett is great and most of all you are at the end of the road in a secluded part of Phuket. It is a 20 minute taxi to Patong which will cost you $10.00 one way. It's a long way from the action so if you want to party and watch boxing and so on then this will probably not be the place for you. Katathani is relaxing, tranquil, the beach is clean, the staff are very friendly, the spa is great and I received a complimentary massage when I arrived.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't book transfers from the airport. Go get a taxi on the day. It will cost you 600 Baht from airport to the hotel. Otherwise, if you buy online prior to leaving you will pay about 2,500 Baht.
reviews.title: Fantastic resort

likes.disliked: — price of telephone calls from the hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything is cheap in Thailand so save your money till you get there so you can get taxis, scooters, food ,etc at great prices.
reviews.title: Great beach front location but needs a 'renovation rescue'

likes.disliked: — The room

reviews.title: A perfect honeymoon
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel and look forward to visiting again in the near future.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Katathani with my husband for 8 nights at the end of May, 2008. It was our first trip to Thailand and we had a great holiday. The resort was lovely, with great rooms and amenities. We chose a junior suite, which was a fine choice. It was quite generous in size, nice bathroom (with bath), very comfortable king bed, sitting area and balcony. Initially, we were given an end room on the first floor, quite close to reception and restaurant. It didn't have a great view. I requested another room. We were given a room on the third floor overlooking pool, beach and garden. Very nice. The staff were a pleasure to deal with.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon Hote, We Loved It!

likes.disliked: — nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 10 night stay at the Katathani. We chose 2 interconnecting Junior Suites which were in the Ocean Wing of the Thani wing of the hotel. This is a much better location than the Bhuri wing rooms. That part of the hotel is still nice, but is set back a bit further from the beach, and a bit more of a walk to most of the restaurants.
reviews.title: Excellent location on a quiet beach

likes.liked: — Location right on the beach, great family friendly pools, quieter location than mayhem of Patong
likes.disliked: — Taxi mafia due to location means small premium (AU$2-3 to get anywhere)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room overlooked the beach, and was a walk down the stairs accross a very short patch of grass onto the beach.
reviews.title: Pleasant enough but disappointing

likes.disliked: — The state of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pools in the hotel were fantastic, and our kids enjoyed a swim every day during our stay. The food in the hotel was pretty good. Yes - it is more expensive than in town, but not too much. The Thai restaurant Channada is very good. Le Scala was also nice, but I thought maybe a little overpriced for what it was, and Fishermans Wharf which is right on the beachfront was good. The main buffet in the evenings and theme nights was so, so - would probably give these a skip next time.
reviews.title: Couldn't be Better

likes.disliked: — Nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also ate at Mom Tri's Kitchen, which is along the cliffside overlooking Kata Noi beach (the beach where the KataThani is located). The food there was really good, and the location amazing, but be prepared to pay more - still not as expensive as a really nice restaurant in Sydney - cost us about AU$100 for family of four, but that it without wine - which is very expensive in Thailand.
reviews.title: Excellant Kata Thani. (paul&jane)

likes.liked: — the water feature in the bathroom.
likes.disliked: — nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Katathani has a great location, and we really enjoyed being right on the beachfront. It is a much smaller beach and better protected than Patong or Karon, but the surf seemed to be slightly better at Kata which is just to the north. The pools are right along the beachside. You also get the option for a wonderful massage poolside for 300THB for about 1hr. It is excellent value and well worth it.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved Katathani

likes.liked: — The fantastic beach, pool and view from our room and balcony
likes.disliked: — It is a little removed from shops and restaurants

aka: Katathani Phuket Beach Hotel Kata Beach
description: Resting along 850 meters of unspoiled white sandy beach, embraced by lush green hills and sparkling blue ocean, Katathani Phuket Beach Resort recalls a tropical dream. Warm sands, the soft rhythm of lapping waves, and gently swaying coconut palms relax your senses—while our six swimming pools, six restaurants, and full-service spa delight them.
